meanings.definition: A wooden pin or peg used to fasten timbers together.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter hammered the trunnels into the wooden beams.
meanings.sent2: The trunnels held the structure firmly in place.
meanings.sent3: Why did the trunnels go to the party? To pin things together!
meanings.sent4: The trunnels were like tiny soldiers, holding the fort together.
meanings.sent5: The trunnels were like the glue that kept the wooden pieces united.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with trunnels.
meanings.sent1: She carefully trunneled the pieces of wood together.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter trunneled the joints for extra strength.
meanings.sent3: Why did the woodworker always carry a hammer? To trunnel things, of course!
meanings.sent4: Her determination trunneled her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The trunneling process made the structure sturdy and reliable.

meanings.definition: The act of using trunnels in construction.
meanings.sent1: The trunneling of the beams was crucial for the stability of the building.
meanings.sent2: His expertise in trunneling made him a sought-after carpenter.
meanings.sent3: Why did the construction worker learn about trunneling? To build better structures!
meanings.sent4: The trunneling process was like weaving a strong fabric of wood.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of trunneling echoed through the construction site.
